meta.name: Soma Clinical Wellness Design System
meta.description: A design system for clinical-grade wellness products with emphasis on trust, science, and accessibility

primary: Clinical credibility through clean, scientific aesthetic
Accessibility and clarity for medical information
design_principles.visual_strategy: Balance sterile medical precision with approachable wellness branding

brand_primary.usage: Primary CTA, brand elements, key interactive states
brand_primary.notes: Likely a clinical blue or sophisticated neutral for trust

color_palette.notes: Clinical color scheme emphasizes trust, cleanliness, and scientific credibility

primary.name: [Sans-serif - likely Inter, SF Pro, or similar modern sans]
primary.usage: Body text, UI elements, general content

headings.name: [Same as primary or a refined serif for authority]

typography.notes: Typography emphasizes readability for medical/scientific content with clear hierarchy

common_layouts.structure: Full-width container with centered content, headline + subtext + CTA

common_layouts.usage: Product cards, feature listings, benefit sections

common_layouts.structure: Expandable Q&A format with clear questions and detailed answers
common_layouts.characteristics: Medical information presented in digestible format

common_layouts.structure: Statistics, certifications, badges in horizontal layout

primary.usage: Primary actions, Add to Cart, Get Started

secondary.style: Outline or ghost style with transparent background

product_card.style: Clean white background, subtle border or shadow
product_card.hover_state: Subtle elevation or border color change

header.background: White or transparent with blur on scroll

footer.structure: Multi-column layout with categories, links, social, legal

input_field.border: 1px solid neutral, focus with primary color
input_field.label: Above input or floating label pattern

icons.library: Custom or from system like Heroicons, Lucide

medical_credibility.pattern: Scientific claims backed by linked sources
medical_credibility.typography: Body text with subtle link styling
medical_credibility.example: 'FDA has categorized peptides as GRAS' with linked reference

educational_content.structure: Bold question followed by detailed explanation

trust_signals.placement: Throughout content, especially near CTAs and product info

filtering_browsing.structure: Sidebar or top filters + results grid
filtering_browsing.interaction: Real-time filtering or apply button pattern

accordion_expansion.pattern: Expandable content sections for dense information

image_content_split.pattern: Image on one side, content on other (alternating)

principles.easing: ease-out for entries, ease-in-out for state changes

common_animations.effect: Subtle scale or color transition on hover
Fade in background, slide up content

characteristics: White or neutral backgrounds for products
Lifestyle imagery showing wellness and vitality

image_treatments.optimization: WebP format, responsive srcset, lazy loading

requirements: 3:1 for large text and UI components
Focus visible states on all interactive elements

focus_states.visibility: Highly visible, not relying on color alone

content_structure.ctas: Direct and clear about next steps

tech_stack_recommendations: Modern CSS with custom properties for theming
Tailwind CSS or similar utility framework with custom config
Motion library like Framer Motion for animations
Next.js or similar for performance and SEO

design_tokens.format: CSS custom properties or JSON tokens
design_tokens.usage: All colors, spacing, typography as variables

component_approach.variants: Props-based variations rather than separate components

when_building_similar_designs: Start with establishing design tokens (colors, typography, spacing)
Build component library from smallest to largest (buttons → cards → sections)
Maintain consistent spacing rhythm using 8px base unit
Apply clinical/professional aesthetic through color choices and typography
Use white space generously for clarity and focus
Implement trust signals prominently (badges, certifications, data)
Structure content with clear hierarchy (headline → subtext → CTA)
Add subtle, professional animations for polish
Prioritize accessibility in all interactive elements

key_differentiators.clinical_trust: Use clean design, data-driven content, certification badges
key_differentiators.accessibility: Clear information hierarchy for medical content
key_differentiators.conversion_focused: Clear CTAs, simplified user flows, trust building

prompt_templates.for_cursor_ai: When implementing this design system, use a clinical health-tech aesthetic with emphasis on trust and scientific credibility. Apply a clean, modern design with generous white space, professional typography (likely sans-serif at 16px base), and subtle interactions. Components should follow an 8px spacing rhythm. Color palette emphasizes trust (blues/neutrals) with high contrast for accessibility. All product cards should include trust signals (certifications, testing data). FAQ sections use accordion patterns. Headers are sticky with subtle shadows. Maintain 4.5:1 contrast ratios minimum.
prompt_templates.for_component_generation: Create a [component name] following these guidelines: Use 8px spacing units, rounded corners (8px), primary color for main actions, 600 font-weight for emphasis. Include hover states with subtle elevation or color changes (200ms transition). Ensure WCAG AA compliance. Style should be clean and clinical, appropriate for health/wellness products.
